Creates a model response for the given chat conversation.

requestBody.description: Request body with options for conversational AI.

post.description: Creates an embedding vector representing the input text. Supports both standard OpenAI embedding format and Chat Embeddings API format with messages.
post.summary: Creates an embedding vector representing the input text

requestBody.description: Request body with options for embeddings. Can use either 'input' field (standard) or 'messages' field (Chat Embeddings API).

user_prefix.description:
this will be the virtual path from the storage instance
to the users root directory
we use this to strip the full paths in the frontend so we can deal with only relative paths

directory.description: is this thing a folder or not?

path.description: the relative path to the file from the base path of the storage instance

url.description: the URL that can be used to load the object directly

valid.description: Valid is true if Time is not NULL

attributes.description: Attributes Attributes for repository status summary.

additionalFields.description:
AdditionalFields are any fields present in the Meta that are not
otherwise defined in the protocol.

progressToken.description:
If specified, the caller is requesting out-of-band progress
notifications for this request (as represented by
notifications/progress). The value of this parameter is an
opaque token that will be attached to any subsequent
notifications. The receiver is not obligated to provide these
notifications.

_meta.description: Meta is a metadata object that is reserved by MCP for storing additional information.

description.description: A human-readable description of the tool.

inputSchema.description: A JSON Schema object defining the expected parameters for the tool.

destructiveHint.description: If true, the tool may perform destructive updates

idempotentHint.description: If true, repeated calls with same args have no additional effect

openWorldHint.description: If true, tool interacts with external entities

readOnlyHint.description: If true, the tool does not modify its environment

num_gpu.description:
CRITICAL CONFUSION WARNING 
NumGPU is NOT the number of GPUs in your hardware configuration!
NumGPU is the number of MODEL LAYERS to offload to GPU (-1 for auto-detect all that fit)

Examples:
- NumGPU = -1: Auto-detect max layers that fit (RECOMMENDED - gives full model memory)
- NumGPU = 1:  Only offload 1 layer to GPU (gives tiny memory estimate)
- NumGPU = 0:  CPU only (no GPU layers)

To estimate for different GPU hardware configs (1 GPU vs 4 GPUs),
you pass different GPU configuration arrays to the estimation function,
NOT different NumGPU values!

variant.description: Additional fields for compatibility with Ollama's estimation

fully_loaded.description: Whether all layers fit on GPU

tensor_split.description: Layers per GPU for tensor parallel

finish_reason.description:
FinishReason
stop: API returned complete message,
or a message terminated by one of the stop sequences provided via the stop parameter
length: Incomplete model output due to max_tokens parameter or token limit
function_call: The model decided to call a function
content_filter: Omitted content due to a flag from our content filters
null: API response still in progress or incomplete

name.description:
This property isn't in the official documentation, but it's in
the documentation for the official library for python:
- https://github.com/openai/openai-python/blob/main/chatml.md
- https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken.ipynb

tool_call_id.description: For Role=tool prompts this should be set to the ID given in the assistant's prior request to call a tool.

tool_calls.description: For Role=assistant prompts this may be set to the tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

logit_bias.description:
LogitBias is must be a token id string (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer), not a word string.
incorrect: `"logit_bias":{"You": 6}`, correct: `"logit_bias":{"1639": 6}`
refs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-logit_bias

logprobs.description:
LogProbs indicates whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not.
If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.
This option is currently not available on the gpt-4-vision-preview model.

max_completion_tokens.description:
MaxCompletionTokens An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion,
including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

max_tokens.description:
MaxTokens The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion.
This value can be used to control costs for text generated via API.
This value is now deprecated in favor of max_completion_tokens, and is not compatible with o1 series models.
refs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-max_tokens

metadata.description: Metadata to store with the completion.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Disable the default behavior of parallel tool calls by setting it: false.

reasoning_effort.description: Controls effort on reasoning for reasoning models. It can be set to "low", "medium", or "high".

store.description:
Store can be set to true to store the output of this completion request for use in distillations and evals.
https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-store

stream_options.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set stream: true.

tool_choice.description: This can be either a string or an ToolChoice object.

top_logprobs.description:
TopLogProbs is an integer between 0 and 5 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each
token position, each with an associated log probability.
logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used.

arguments.description: call function with arguments in JSON format

parameters.description:
Parameters is an object describing the function.
You can pass json.RawMessage to describe the schema,
or you can pass in a struct which serializes to the proper JSON schema.
The jsonschema package is provided for convenience, but you should
consider another specialized library if you require more complex schemas.

bytes.description: Omitting the field if it is null

top_logprobs.description:
TopLogProbs is a list of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position.
In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested top_logprobs returned.

content.description: Content is a list of message content tokens with log probability information.

include_usage.description:
If set, an additional chunk will be streamed before the data: [DONE] message.
The usage field on this chunk shows the token usage statistics for the entire request,
and the choices field will always be an empty array.
All other chunks will also include a usage field, but with a null value.

index.description: Index is not nil only in chat completion chunk object

user.description: Owner user struct, populated by the server for organization views

allow_fork.description: AllowFork allows users without write access to fork the repo to their account

default_branch.description: DefaultBranch overrides the default branch for this repo

github_url.description: GitHubURL is the GitHub repository URL (e.g., "github.com/helixml/helix")

is_primary.description: IsPrimary marks this as the primary/default repository for the project

sub_path.description:
SubPath is the directory name to clone into (e.g., "helix", "zed")
If empty, uses the repo name

prompt.description: Natural language request (include all context here)

formatted.description: Formatted is a pre-formatted numbered list for easy consumption

enabled.description: Whether this sample project is shown to users

guidelines.description:
Guidelines are project-specific instructions for AI agents
These get injected into implementation prompts and help the agent understand
project conventions, available tools, and how to use them effectively

required_repositories.description:
RequiredGitHubRepos specifies GitHub repos that must be cloned for this sample project.
When set, the project creation flow will:
1. Check if user has GitHub OAuth connected
2. Verify write access to each repo (or offer to fork)
3. Clone repos with authentication
4. Wait for cloning to complete before starting session

required_scopes.description:
RequiredScopes specifies the OAuth scopes needed for this sample project
These are passed when initiating the OAuth flow, so the user authorizes exactly what's needed

requires_github_auth.description: RequiresGitHubAuth indicates this sample project needs GitHub OAuth for push access

skills.description:
Skills configures project-level skills that will be added when the project is created
These overlay on top of agent-level skills

data.description: Data Data for repository status summary response.

startup_script.description: Custom startup script for this project

valid.description: Valid is true if String is not NULL

user.description: Populated by the server if UserID is set

user_reference.description: Either user ID or user email
Either user ID or user email

x-enum-comments.AgentWorkStateIdle: Agent connected but not actively working

total_cost.description: Total cost of the call (prompt and completion tokens)

organization_id.description: Used for isolation and metrics tracking

project_id.description: Used for isolation and metrics tracking

session_id.description: Session this key is scoped to (ephemeral keys)

spec_task_id.description: Used for isolation and metrics tracking

user.description: Owner user struct, populated by the server for organization views

oauth_scopes.description: Required OAuth scopes for this API

skip_unknown_keys.description:
if true, unknown keys in the response body will be removed before
returning to the agent for interpretation

transform_output.description:
Transform JSON into readable text to reduce the
size of the response body

cache.description: If true, the browser will cache the results of the tool call

markdown_post_processing.description: If true, the browser will return the HTML as markdown

no_browser.description: If true, the browser will not be used to open URLs, it will be a simple GET request

process_output.description: If true, the browser will process the output of the tool call before returning it to the top loop. Useful for skills that return structured data such as Browser,

agent_mode.description: AgentMode triggers the use of the agent loop (deprecated - use AgentType instead)

agent_type.description: AgentType specifies the type of agent to use

code_agent_credential_type.description:
CodeAgentCredentialType specifies how the code agent authenticates with the LLM provider.
"api_key" (default/empty): uses an API key routed through the Helix proxy.
"subscription": uses OAuth credentials directly (e.g., Claude subscription).

code_agent_runtime.description:
CodeAgentRuntime specifies which code agent runtime to use inside Zed (for zed_external agent type).
Options: "zed_agent" (Zed's built-in agent) or "qwen_code" (qwen command as custom agent).
If empty, defaults to "zed_agent".

context_limit.description:
ContextLimit - the number of messages to include in the context for the AI assistant.
When set to 1, the AI assistant will only see and remember the most recent message.

conversation_starters.description:
ConversationStarters is a list of messages that will be presented to the user
when a new session is about to be launched. Use this to showcase the capabilities of the assistant.

frequency_penalty.description:
How much to penalize new tokens based on their frequency in the text so far.
Increases the model's likelihood to talk about new topics
0 - balanced
2 - less repetitive

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate before stopping.

memory.description: Enable/disable user based memory for the agent

presence_penalty.description:
How much to penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far.
Increases the model's likelihood to talk about new topics
0 - balanced
2 - open minded

reasoning_effort.description: Controls effort on reasoning for reasoning models. It can be set to "low", "medium", or "high".

temperature.description:
Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
0.01 - precise
1 - neutral
2 - creative

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling,
where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.
So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
0 - balanced
2 - more creative

description.description:
Description of the knowledge, will be used in the prompt
to explain the knowledge to the assistant

name.description: Name of the knowledge, will be unique within the Helix app

rag_settings.description:
RAGSettings defines the settings for the RAG system, how
chunking is configured and where the index/query service is
hosted.

refresh_enabled.description:
RefreshEnabled defines if the knowledge should be refreshed periodically
or on events. For example a Google Drive knowledge can be refreshed
every 24 hours.

refresh_schedule.description:
RefreshSchedule defines the schedule for refreshing the knowledge.
It can be specified in cron format or as a duration for example '@every 2h'
or 'every 5m' or '0 0 * * *' for daily at midnight.

source.description:
Source defines where the raw data is fetched from. It can be
directly uploaded files, S3, GCS, Google Drive, Gmail, etc.

command.description:
Stdio transport fields (used when Transport is "stdio")
The MCP server runs as a subprocess inside the dev container

oauth_provider.description: The name of the OAuth provider to use for authentication

oauth_scopes.description: Required OAuth scopes for this API

transport.description:
Transport type: "http" (default, Streamable HTTP), "sse" (legacy SSE), or "stdio" (command execution)
For stdio transport, use Command/Args/Env fields instead of URL

url.description: HTTP/SSE transport fields (used when Transport is "http" or "sse", or URL is set)

x-enum-comments.AuditEventAgentPrompt: Prompt sent from Helix UI to agent
x-enum-comments.AuditEventUserMessage: Message sent by user inside agent (via WebSocket)

clone_group_id.description: Group ID linking related cloned tasks

cloned_from_project_id.description: Source project ID if cloned from another project

interaction_id.description: For scrolling to specific interaction in session view

spec_version.description: Spec versioning - capture spec state at time of event

x-enum-comments.AuthProviderRegular: Embedded in Helix, no external dependencies

tenant_id.description:
Service Principal authentication (service-to-service via Azure AD/Entra ID)
Uses OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow for automated system access

app_password.description: Bitbucket App Password (recommended over regular password)

base_url.description: For Bitbucket Server/Data Center (empty for bitbucket.org)
Base URL for self-hosted instances (for GitHub Enterprise, GitLab Enterprise, or Bitbucket Server)

token.description: Personal Access Token or App Password for authentication

tool_call_id.description: For Role=tool prompts this should be set to the ID given in the assistant's prior request to call a tool.

tool_calls.description: For Role=assistant prompts this may be set to the tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

full_tasks.description: Full task objects for TaskCard rendering

name.description: Optional, will use repo name if not provided

agent_name.description: AgentName is the name used in Zed's agent_servers config (e.g., "qwen", "claude-code")

api_type.description: APIType specifies the API format: "anthropic", "openai", or "azure_openai"

base_url.description: BaseURL is the Helix proxy endpoint URL (e.g., "https://helix.example.com/v1")

max_output_tokens.description:
MaxOutputTokens is the model's max completion tokens
Looked up from model_info.json, 0 if not found

max_tokens.description:
MaxTokens is the model's context window size (max input tokens)
Looked up from model_info.json, 0 if not found

provider.description: Provider is the LLM provider name (e.g., "anthropic", "openai", "openrouter")

runtime.description: Runtime specifies which code agent runtime to use: "zed_agent" or "qwen_code"

action_label.description: Forms the grouping in the UI

label.description: The label that will be shown in the UI

value.description: The value written to the text area when the action is selected

owner_id.description: Required for org-level, auto-set for user

project_id.description: optional, if set, the secret will be available to the specified project

app_id.description: Optional: Helix agent to use for spec generation

base_branch.description: For new mode: branch to create from (defaults to repo default)

branch_prefix.description: For new mode: user-specified prefix (task# appended)

depends_on.description: Optional: IDs of tasks this task depends on

just_do_it_mode.description: Optional: Skip spec planning, go straight to implementation

user_email.description: Optional: User email for audit trail

working_branch.description: For existing mode: branch to continue working on

resolution.description: Display resolution - either use Resolution preset or explicit dimensions

repositories_to_fork.description: List of GitHub URLs to fork

configured_skill_env_vars.description:
ConfiguredSkillEnvVars contains user-configured env vars for skills
Outer key: skill name, Inner key: env var name, Value: user-provided value
This allows users to configure skills (like API tokens) during project creation

fork_to_organization.description:
For repos the user doesn't have write access to, fork them to this target
If empty, forks to user's personal GitHub account

github_connection_id.description:
GitHub OAuth connection ID for authenticated cloning
Required for sample projects with RequiresGitHubAuth=true

helix_app_id.description: Optional: agent app to use for spec tasks (uses default if empty)

organization_id.description: Optional: if empty, project is personal

repository_decisions.description:
RepositoryDecisions maps repo URLs to the user's decision about access
Key: GitHub URL (e.g., "github.com/helixml/helix")
Value: "use_original" (has write access) or "fork" (will fork)

cloning_in_progress.description: CloningInProgress indicates repos are still being cloned

repositories_created.description: RepositoriesCreated lists the repositories attached to the project

model_name.description: GPU model name (e.g., "NVIDIA H100 PCIe", "AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX")

sdk_version.description: GPU SDK version (CUDA for NVIDIA, ROCm for AMD)

app_id.description:
GitHub App authentication (service-to-service)
When AppID and PrivateKey are set, uses GitHub App installation tokens

base_url.description: For GitHub Enterprise instances (empty for github.com)

installation_id.description: Installation ID for the app on the org/repo

private_key.description: PEM-encoded private key for JWT signing

base_url.description: For self-hosted GitLab instances (empty for gitlab.com)
For GitHub Enterprise or GitLab Enterprise: base URL (empty = github.com/gitlab.com)

name.description: Display name for the connection (e.g., "My GitHub Account")

user_id.description: User who owns this connection (PAT is personal, not org-level)

username.description: User info from the provider (cached from last successful auth)

clone_error.description: Clone progress tracking for async cloning

clone_url.description: For Helix-hosted: http://api/git/{repo_id}, For external: https://github.com/org/repo.git

external_url.description: Full URL to external repo (e.g., https://github.com/org/repo)

local_path.description: Local filesystem path for Helix-hosted repos (empty for external)

oauth_connection_id.description:
OAuth connection ID - references an OAuthConnection for authentication
When set, uses the OAuth access token instead of username/password or PAT

organization_id.description: Organization ID - will be backfilled for existing repos

project_id.description:
Deprecated: ProjectID is maintained for backward compatibility only.
Use the project_repositories junction table for many-to-many project-repo relationships.
This column is kept in the database for rollback compatibility but reads should use the junction table.

external_url.description: Full URL to external repo (e.g., https://github.com/org/repo)

is_external.description: True for GitHub/GitLab/ADO, false for Helix-hosted

oauth_connection_id.description: OAuth connection ID - references an OAuthConnection for authentication

organization_id.description: Organization ID - required for access control

x-enum-comments.GitRepositoryTypeCode: Code repository (user projects, samples, external repos)

kodit_indexing.description: Enable Kodit code intelligence indexing (pointer to distinguish unset from false)

optimization_score.description: How optimal the final decision was

updated_by_email.description: User email (not persisted, populated at query time)

updated_by_name.description: User display name (not persisted, populated at query time)

display_message.description: if this is defined, the UI will always display it instead of the message (so we can augment the internal prompt with RAG context)

duration_ms.description: How long the interaction took to complete in milliseconds

generation_id.description:
GenerationID, starts at 0, increments for each regeneration (when user retries a message, anywhere from the past)
it is used to keep a timeline when querying the database for messages or viewing previous generations

last_zed_message_id.description:
LastZedMessageID tracks the last Zed message ID received for this interaction.
Used to detect multi-message responses: same ID = streaming update (overwrite),
different ID = new distinct message (append). Persisted in DB for restart resilience.

response_message.description:
TODO: add the full multi-part response content
ResponseMessageContent MessageContent `json:"response_message_content"` // LLM response

runner.description: the ID of the runner that processed this interaction

summary.description:
Summary is a one-line description of this interaction for search/indexing.
Generated lazily on first access or via background job.

system_prompt.description: System prompt for the interaction (copy of the session's system prompt that was used to create this interaction)

tool_call_id.description: For Role=tool prompts this should be set to the ID given in the assistant's prior request to call a tool.

tool_calls.description: For Role=assistant prompts this may be set to the tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

tools.description: Model function calling, not to be mistaken with Helix tools

app_id.description: AppID through which the knowledge was created

crawled_sources.description: URLs crawled in the last run (should match last knowledge version)

description.description:
Description of the knowledge, will be used in the prompt
to explain the knowledge to the assistant

next_run.description: Populated by the cron job controller

refresh_enabled.description:
RefreshEnabled defines if the knowledge should be refreshed periodically
or on events. For example a Google Drive knowledge can be refreshed
every 24 hours.

refresh_schedule.description:
RefreshSchedule defines the schedule for refreshing the knowledge.
It can be specified in cron format or as a duration for example '@every 2h'
or 'every 5m' or '0 0 * * *' for daily at midnight.

size.description: Size of the knowledge in bytes

source.description:
Source defines where the raw data is fetched from. It can be
directly uploaded files, S3, GCS, Google Drive, Gmail, etc.

version.description:
Version of the knowledge, will be used to separate different versions
of the same knowledge when updating it. Format is
YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM-SS.

drive_id.description: DriveID is the document library drive ID (optional, defaults to the site's default drive)

filter_extensions.description: FilterExtensions limits which file types to include (e.g., [".pdf", ".docx", ".txt"])

folder_path.description: FolderPath is the path to a specific folder within the drive (optional, defaults to root)

oauth_provider_id.description: OAuthProviderID is the ID of the Microsoft OAuth provider to use for authentication

recursive.description: Recursive determines whether to include files in subfolders

site_id.description: SiteID is the SharePoint site ID (can be obtained from Graph API or site URL)

embeddings_model.description: Model used to embed the knowledge

total_cost.description: Total cost of the call (prompt and completion tokens)

parts.description:
Parts is a list of strings or objects. For example for text, it's a list of strings, for
multi-modal it can be an object:
"parts": [
		{
				"content_type": "image_asset_pointer",
				"asset_pointer": "file-service://file-28uHss2LgJ8HUEEVAnXa70Tg",
				"size_bytes": 185427,
				"width": 2048,
				"height": 1020,
				"fovea": null,
				"metadata": null
		},
		"what is in the image?"
]

allocated_memory.description: EXPORTED ALLOCATION FIELDS: Set by NewModelForGPUAllocation based on scheduler's GPU allocation decision

auto_pull.description: Whether to automatically pull the model if missing in the runner

concurrency.description: max concurrent requests per slot (0 = use global default)

memory.description: DATABASE FIELD: Admin-configured memory for VLLM models, MUST be 0 for Ollama models

prewarm.description: Whether to prewarm this model to fill free GPU memory on runners

runtime_args.description: Runtime-specific arguments (e.g., VLLM command line args)

sort_order.description: Order for sorting models in UI (lower numbers appear first)

user_modified.description: User modification tracking - system defaults are automatically updated if this is false

warnings.description: Warnings about things that won't be moved automatically

affected_projects.description: Other projects that will lose this repo

provider.description: Provider is a reference to the OAuth provider

tool_call_id.description: For Role=tool prompts this should be set to the ID given in the assistant's prior request to call a tool.

tool_calls.description: For Role=assistant prompts this may be set to the tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

auto_join_domain.description:
AutoJoinDomain - if set, users logging in via OIDC with this email domain are automatically added as members
Note: Uniqueness is enforced in application code (updateOrganization handler) rather than DB constraint
because empty strings would conflict with each other in a unique index

guidelines.description: Guidelines for AI agents - style guides, conventions, and instructions that apply to all projects

guidelines_updated_by.description: User ID who last updated guidelines

role.description: Role - the role of the user in the organization (owner or member)

x-enum-comments.OrganizationRoleMember: Can see every member and team in the organization and can create new apps
x-enum-comments.OrganizationRoleOwner: Has full administrative access to the entire organization.

default_helix_app_id.description:
Default agent for spec tasks in this project (App ID)
New spec tasks inherit this agent; can be overridden per-task

default_repo_id.description:
Project-level repository management
DefaultRepoID is the PRIMARY repository - startup script lives at .helix/startup.sh in this repo

guidelines.description:
Guidelines for AI agents - project-specific style guides, conventions, and instructions
Combined with organization guidelines when constructing prompts

guidelines_updated_by.description: User ID who last updated guidelines

next_task_number.description:
Auto-incrementing task number for human-readable directory names
Each SpecTask gets assigned the next number (install-cowsay_1, add-api_2, etc.)

skills.description:
Project-level skills - these overlay on top of agent skills
Useful for project-specific tools like CI integration (e.g., drone-ci-mcp)

startup_script.description: Transient field - loaded from primary code repo's .helix/startup.sh, never persisted to database

pull_request_reviews_enabled.description: Whether pull request reviews are enabled

id.description: Composite primary key: ID is globally unique, but we also index by user+spec_task

interrupt.description:
Interrupt indicates this message should interrupt the current conversation
When false, message waits until current conversation completes

project_id.description: For reference, but primary grouping is by spec_task

queue_position.description:
QueuePosition tracks ordering for drag-and-drop reordering
Lower values = earlier in queue. Null for sent messages.

session_id.description: Optional - which session this was sent to

status.description:
Status tracks whether this was successfully sent
Values: "pending", "sent", "failed"

is_template.description: If true, saved as a reusable template

queue_position.description: Position in queue for drag-and-drop ordering

entries.description: All entries for this user+project (for client merge)

api_key_file.description: Must be mounted to the container

headers.description: If for example anthropic expects x-api-key and anthropic-version

organization_id.description: The organization this session belongs to, if any

chunk_overflow.description: the amount of overlap between chunks - will default to 32 bytes

chunk_size.description: the size of each text chunk - will default to 2000 bytes

delete_url.description: the URL of the delete endpoint (defaults to Helix RAG_DELETE_URL env var)

disable_chunking.description: if true, we will not chunk the text and send the entire file to the RAG indexing endpoint

disable_downloading.description: if true, we will not download the file and send the URL to the RAG indexing endpoint

distance_function.description: this is one of l2, inner_product or cosine - will default to cosine

enable_vision.description: if true, we will use the vision pipeline -- Future - might want to specify different pipelines

index_url.description: RAG endpoint configuration if used with a custom RAG service

prompt_template.description: the prompt template to use for the RAG query

query_url.description: the URL of the query endpoint (defaults to Helix RAG_QUERY_URL env var)

results_count.description: this is the max number of results to return - will default to 3

threshold.description: this is the threshold for a "good" answer - will default to 0.2

existing_fork.description: URL of existing fork if any

full_name.description: e.g., "owner/repo" for GitHub or "group/project" for GitLab

html_url.description: Web URL to view the repository

desktop_versions.description:
Desktop image versions (content-addressable Docker image hashes)
Key: desktop name (e.g., "sway", "zorin", "ubuntu")
Value: image hash (e.g., "a1b2c3d4e5f6...")

disk_usage.description: Disk usage metrics for monitored mount points

privileged_mode_enabled.description: Privileged mode (host Docker access for development)

desktop_versions.description:
Desktop image versions available on this sandbox
Key: desktop name (e.g., "sway", "ubuntu"), Value: image hash

x-enum-comments.SchedulingDecisionTypeEvictStaleSlot: Evicted stale slot to free memory
x-enum-comments.SchedulingDecisionTypeUnschedulable: Cannot be scheduled (no warm slots available)

app_id.description: optional, if set, the secret will be available to the specified app

project_id.description: optional, if set, the secret will be available as env var in project sessions

providers_management_enabled.description: Controls if users can add their own AI provider API keys

registration_enabled.description:
used to prepend onto raw filestore paths to download files
the filestore path will have the user info in it - i.e.
it's a low level filestore path
if we are using an object storage thing - then this URL
can be the prefix to the bucket

ado_organization_url.description: Azure DevOps Service Principal (non-sensitive fields only)
Azure DevOps Service Principal fields (only update if provided)

github_app_id.description: GitHub App fields (only update if provided)

deleted_at.description: Soft delete support - allows cleanup of orphaned lobbies

interactions.description:
for now we just whack the entire history of the interaction in here, json
style

lora_dir.description:
if type == finetune, we record a filestore path to e.g. lora file here
currently the only place you can do inference on a finetune is within the
session where the finetune was generated

name.description:
name that goes in the UI - ideally autogenerated by AI but for now can be
named manually

organization_id.description: the organization this session belongs to, if any

parent_app.description:
the app this session was spawned from
TODO: rename to AppID

provider.description:
huggingface model name e.g. mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.1 or
stabilityai/stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0

question_set_execution_id.description: The question set execution this session belongs to, if any

question_set_id.description: The question set this session belongs to, if any

sandbox_id.description: SandboxID tracks which sandbox instance is running this session's dev container (if any)

app_id.description: Assign the session settings from the specified app

assistant_id.description: Which assistant are we speaking to?

interaction_id.description: If empty, we will start a new interaction

organization_id.description: The organization this session belongs to, if any

project_id.description: The project this session belongs to, if any

regenerate.description: If true, we will regenerate the response for the last message

session_id.description: If empty, we will start a new session

stream.description: If true, we will stream the response

system.description: System message, only applicable when starting a new session

tools.description: Available tools to use in the session

agent_video_width.description: Video settings for external agent sessions (Phase 3.5)

app_query_params.description: Passing through user defined app params

assistant_id.description: which assistant are we talking to?

code_agent_runtime.description: Which code agent runtime is used (zed_agent, qwen_code, claude_code, etc.)

eval_run_id.description:
Evals are cool. Scores are strings of floats so we can distinguish ""
(not rated) from "0.0"

external_agent_id.description: NEW: External agent ID for this session

external_agent_status.description: NEW: External agent status (running, stopped, terminated_idle)

gpu_vendor.description: GPU vendor of sandbox running this session (nvidia, amd, intel, none)

implementation_task_index.description: Index of implementation task this session handles

paused_screenshot_path.description: Path to saved screenshot when agent is paused

project_id.description: ID of associated Project (for exploratory sessions)

rag_enabled.description:
these settings control which features of a session we want to use
even if we have a Lora file and RAG indexed prepared
we might choose to not use them (this will help our eval framework know what works the best)
we well as activate RAG - we also get to control some properties, e.g. which distance function to use,
and what the threshold for a "good" answer is

render_node.description: GPU render node of sandbox (/dev/dri/renderD128 or SOFTWARE)

sway_version.description: helix-sway image version (commit hash) running in this session

system_session.description: True for internal system sessions (e.g., summary generation) - skip summary generation to avoid loops

text_finetune_enabled.description: without any user input, this will default to true

title_history.description:
Title history - tracks evolution of session topics (newest first)
Shown on hover in the SpecTask tab view to see what topics were covered

uploaded_data_entity_id.description: when we do fine tuning or RAG, we need to know which data entity we used

x-enum-comments.SessionModeAction: Running tool actions (e.g. API, function calls)

created.description: these are all values of the last interaction

metadata.description: Metadata includes container information for external agent sessions

summary.description: this is either the prompt or the summary of the training data

skipUnknownKeys.description:
if true, unknown keys in the response body will be removed before
returning to the agent for interpretation

transformOutput.description:
Transform JSON into readable text to reduce the
size of the response body

project_channel.description: Send project updates to this channel

project_updates.description: Send project updates (spec task creation, completion, etc)

agent_work_state.description: Current agent work state (idle/working/done) from activity tracking

archived.description: Archive to hide from main view

base_branch.description: The base branch this was created from

branch_prefix.description: User-specified prefix for new branches (task# appended)

clone_group_id.description: Groups tasks from same clone operation

design_docs_pushed_at.description: When design docs were pushed to helix-specs branch

external_agent_id.description: External agent tracking (single agent per SpecTask, spans entire workflow)

helix_app_id.description: NEW: Single Helix Agent for entire workflow (App type in code)

just_do_it_mode.description: Skip spec planning, go straight to implementation

last_prompt_content.description: Last prompt sent to agent (for continue functionality)

merged_to_main.description: Whether branch was merged to main

original_prompt.description: Kiro's actual approach: simple, human-readable artifacts

planning_session_id.description:
Session tracking (single Helix session for entire workflow - planning + implementation)
The same external agent/session is reused throughout the entire SpecTask lifecycle

session_updated_at.description: Agent activity tracking (computed from session/activity data, not stored)

short_title.description:
Short title for tab display (auto-generated from agent writing short-title.txt)
UserShortTitle takes precedence if set (user override)

status.description: Spec-driven workflow statuses - see constants below

task_number.description:
Human-readable directory naming for design docs in helix-specs branch
TaskNumber is auto-assigned from project.NextTaskNumber when task starts
DesignDocPath format: "YYYY-MM-DD_shortname_N" e.g., "2025-12-09_install-cowsay_1"

requirements_spec.description: Design document snapshots at time of review

comment_type.description: Made optional - simplified to single type

queued_at.description:
Database-backed queue for agent processing (restart-resilient)
QueuedAt is set when comment is submitted for agent processing.
Processing order: QueuedAt ASC. Cleared when agent response is received.

quoted_text.description: For inline comments - store the context around the comment

request_id.description: Request ID used when sending to agent (for response linking)

x-enum-comments.TaskStatusBacklog: Initial state, waiting for spec generation
x-enum-comments.TaskStatusPullRequest: External repo: PR opened, awaiting merge
x-enum-comments.TaskStatusQueuedImplementation: Transitional state, waiting for the orchestrator to pick it up
x-enum-comments.TaskStatusQueuedSpecGeneration: Transitional state, waiting for the orchestrator to pick it up

depends_on.description: IDs of tasks this task depends on

helix_app_id.description: Agent to use for this task

user_short_title.description: User override for tab title (pointer to allow clearing with empty string)

agent_work_state.description: Current agent work state (idle/working/done) from activity tracking

archived.description: Archive to hide from main view

base_branch.description: The base branch this was created from

branch_prefix.description: User-specified prefix for new branches (task# appended)

clone_group_id.description: Groups tasks from same clone operation

design_docs_pushed_at.description: When design docs were pushed to helix-specs branch

external_agent_id.description: External agent tracking (single agent per SpecTask, spans entire workflow)

helix_app_id.description: NEW: Single Helix Agent for entire workflow (App type in code)

just_do_it_mode.description: Skip spec planning, go straight to implementation

last_prompt_content.description: Last prompt sent to agent (for continue functionality)

merged_to_main.description: Whether branch was merged to main

original_prompt.description: Kiro's actual approach: simple, human-readable artifacts

planning_session_id.description:
Session tracking (single Helix session for entire workflow - planning + implementation)
The same external agent/session is reused throughout the entire SpecTask lifecycle

session_updated_at.description: Agent activity tracking (computed from session/activity data, not stored)

short_title.description:
Short title for tab display (auto-generated from agent writing short-title.txt)
UserShortTitle takes precedence if set (user override)

status.description: Spec-driven workflow statuses - see constants below

task_number.description:
Human-readable directory naming for design docs in helix-specs branch
TaskNumber is auto-assigned from project.NextTaskNumber when task starts
DesignDocPath format: "YYYY-MM-DD_shortname_N" e.g., "2025-12-09_install-cowsay_1"

helix_session_id.description: Maps to Helix session (multiple Zed threads can share one session)

work_session.description:
Relationships (loaded via joins, not stored in database)
NOTE: We store IDs, not nested objects, to avoid circular references
Use GORM preloading: db.Preload("WorkSession").Find(&zedThread)

keyboard_layout.description:
KeyboardLayout is the XKB keyboard layout code (e.g., "us", "fr", "de")
Used to configure the desktop container's keyboard layout from browser detection

details.description: That were used to call the tool

duration_ms.description: How long the step took in milliseconds (useful for API calls, database queries, etc.)

icon.description: Either Material UI icon, emoji or SVG. Leave empty for default

kodit_enrichment_model_set.description: true if both provider and model are configured

kodit_enrichment_provider.description: Kodit enrichment model configuration (not sensitive, returned as-is)

interaction_id.description: Interaction ID for navigation - click to jump here

turn.description: Turn number that triggered the change (1-indexed)

system_prompt.description: E.g. As a restaurant expert, you provide personalized restaurant recommendations

actions.description: Read-only, parsed from schema on creation

oauth_scopes.description: Required OAuth scopes for this API

path_params.description: Path parameters that will be substituted in URLs

query.description: Query parameters that will be always set

request_prep_template.description: Template for request preparation, leave empty for default

response_error_template.description: Template for error response, leave empty for default

response_success_template.description: Template for successful response, leave empty for default

skip_unknown_keys.description:
if true, unknown keys in the response body will be removed before
returning to the agent for interpretation

system_prompt.description: System prompt to guide the AI when using this API

transform_output.description:
Transform JSON into readable text to reduce the
size of the response body

cache.description: If true, the browser will cache the results of the tool call

markdown_post_processing.description: If true, the browser will return the HTML as markdown

no_browser.description: If true, the browser will not be used to open URLs, it will be a simple GET request

process_output.description: If true, the browser will process the output of the tool call before returning it to the top loop. Useful for skills that return structured data such as Browser,

oauth_scopes.description: Required OAuth scopes for this API

webhook_url.description: Webhook URL for the trigger configuration, applicable to webhook type triggers like Azure DevOps, GitHub, etc.

name.description: Will most likely match session name, based on the trigger name at the time of execution

api_key_file.description: Must be mounted to the container

duration_ms.description: How long the request took in milliseconds

admin.description: if the ID of the user is contained in the env setting

app_id.description: if the token is associated with an app

must_change_password.description: if the user must change their password

organization_id.description: Organization this API key is scoped to (ephemeral keys)

project_id.description: When running in Helix Code sandbox

session_id.description: Session this API key is scoped to (ephemeral keys)

spec_task_id.description: When running in Helix Code sandbox

token.description: the actual token used and its type

type.description:
these are set by the keycloak user based on the token
if it's an app token - the keycloak user is loaded from the owner of the app
if it's a runner token - these values will be empty

max_depth.description: Limit crawl depth to avoid infinite crawling

readability.description: Apply readability middleware to the HTML content

claude_subscription_available.description: True if user has an active Claude subscription for credential sync

code_agent_config.description: Code agent configuration for Zed agentic coding

version.description: Unix timestamp of app config update
